channel.title: Two iPhone 1st generation repairs
channel.description:
Both of the digitizers are responsive but have wide cracks on the screen, except on one the power button isn't working. The main goal for me is to refurbish these dinosaurs and resell them. Would it be pricey to get the screens replaced? Would it be easy and cheaper to replace them myself? or should i just go ahead and sell them for parts?
Opinions please.

item.title: Two iPhone 1st generation repairs
item.dc:creator: @benny679 benny679
item.description:
@benny679 wrote:

[quote=“abatssk8ter, post:1, topic:349486”]Both of the digitizers are responsive but have wide cracks on the screen, except on one the power button isn’t working. The main goal for me is to refurbish these dinosaurs and resell them. Would it be pricey to get the screens replaced? Would it be easy and cheaper to replace them myself? or should i just go ahead and sell them for parts?

Opinions please.[/quote]

I got an ipod touch 1g lcd for $10. I didn’t even need it, just got it in case

By the way, I’ll buy one if you fix it up.

Read full topic

item.title: Two iPhone 1st generation repairs
item.dc:creator: @peterbjornx peterbjornx
item.description:
@peterbjornx wrote:

LCD screens usually are pricey, i remember paying 30 euros for a 1.2 inch one for a SE T690 back in '05

Read full topic
